content: nneeww wwaavvee knitting the staple scrunchie fo elbat stnetnoc how this pattern works 1 this pattern starts with inputting your gauge and measurements into the field on the gauge and measurements pages calculations are done in the background and will calculate the amount of stitches needed to fit your body perfectly these calculations will show up exactly where you will need them in the pattern no need to fill them in yourself 2 it is recommended that you view this pattern on adobe reader for the formatting to be *just right* adobe reader can be downloaded for free on your computer or as an app on both apple and android phones or devices 3 once you ve entered your measurements you should no longer need to use adobe reader be sure to save the document after you enter everything read this p 3 about p 4 sizing materials and yarns p 5 input your info p 6 abbreviations + techniques p 8 pattern p 11 thank you about the scrunchie the staple scrunchie is a knitted scrunchie that can work with any weight yarn and any gauge it s the perfect stash busting project so you can make an endless variety of scrunchies to add some extra flair to your every day knit fits seamless design 3 sizes small regular mega no sewing necessary a note from the designer thank you so much for purchasing this design and wanting to make something that i created it seriously means the world to me i hope this process is smooth sailing for you and that you end up with a well-fitting and cute handmade scrunchie that you will flaunt for years to come <3 jeanette terms of use please support and respect small creators this pattern is for personal and non-commercial use only you may not copy redistribute sell or share this pattern you may sell garments made with this pattern but you must credit new wave knitting as the designer for commercial reproduction contact the designer at newwaveknitting@gmail com 3 sizing + fit this pattern is designed to create scrunchies that are 18 in circumference before incorporating the elastic you can adjust the elastic as needed for your preferred fit and hair needs but this pattern gives guidance on incorporating elastic that should hug your wrist snugly materials needles 2 sets of 16 40 cm circular needles in terms of needle sizes you will need needle size a your main working needle size that you use to achieve gauge needle size b ideally 5mm smaller than needle size a but you can size down more if you don t have one size smaller on hand this smaller set will only be used when seaming the scrunchie at the end *you can also use 2 sets of 36 + circular needles to use with magic loop however guidance is not provided for how to do this tools 1 stitch marker tapestry needle scissors measuring tape 9 23 cm of elastic recommended
